New Records: DR Congo won their first match in the Africa Cup of Nations 2023 after a penalty shootout against Egypt
Key Match Events: DR Congo won 8-7 on penalties after a 1-1 draw
Egypt's goalkeeper Mohamed Abou Gabal missed a crucial penalty in the shootout
DR Congo's goalkeeper Lionel Mpasi scored the winning penalty
Egyptian midfielder Mohamed Hamdy received a red card in extra time
Guinea secured a 1-0 win over Equatorial Guinea with a last-minute header by Mohamed Bayo
Pre-Game Insights: Egypt faced a tough challenge without their star player Mohamed Salah, who was recovering from a hamstring injury
DR Congo's journey in the tournament was marked by criticism after group stage performances
Both teams prepared strategically, with DR Congo's coach emphasizing the need for resilience
Post-Match Reflections: DR Congo's coach expressed satisfaction with the victory and praised his players' efforts
Guinea's coach Kaba Diawara highlighted the team's hard work and patience despite a slow start
